# shadcn/ui

shadcn/ui is a collection of beautifully designed, accessible React components that you can copy and paste directly into your projects. Unlike traditional component libraries where you install a package from NPM, shadcn/ui gives you the actual component source code, allowing full customization and ownership. Built on top of Radix UI primitives and styled with Tailwind CSS, the components are designed to work with React 19 and Tailwind CSS v4.

The project follows an "Open Code" philosophy where the top layer of your component code is open for modification. This makes components predictable for both developers and AI models. The CLI tool (`shadcn`) handles installation, configuration, and component management across various frameworks including Next.js, Vite, Remix, Astro, and more. It also supports monorepo setups and custom component registries.

## CLI Commands

### Initialize a New Project

The `init` command sets up your project with the necessary configuration, dependencies, and CSS variables for shadcn/ui components.

```bash
# Initialize a new project
npx shadcn@latest init

# Initialize with specific options
npx shadcn@latest init -t next -b neutral -y

# Options:
#   -t, --template <template>      Template to use (next, next-monorepo)
#   -b, --base-color <base-color>  Base color (neutral, gray, zinc, stone, slate)
#   -y, --yes                      Skip confirmation prompt
#   -f, --force                    Force overwrite existing configuration
#   -c, --cwd <cwd>                Working directory (defaults to current)
#   --src-dir                      Use src directory for new project
#   --css-variables                Use CSS variables for theming (default: true)
```

### Add Components

The `add` command installs components and their dependencies into your project. Components are copied as source files, giving you full control.

```bash
# Add a single component
npx shadcn@latest add button

# Add multiple components
npx shadcn@latest add button card dialog

# Add all available components
npx shadcn@latest add -a

# Add from a URL or namespaced registry
npx shadcn@latest add https://ui.shadcn.com/r/button.json
npx shadcn@latest add @acme/custom-button

# Options:
#   -y, --yes           Skip confirmation prompt
#   -o, --overwrite     Overwrite existing files
#   -c, --cwd <cwd>     Working directory
#   -a, --all           Add all available components
#   -p, --path <path>   Custom path for component installation
#   -s, --silent        Mute output
```

### View Components Before Installing

The `view` command lets you preview component source code before adding them to your project.

```bash
# View a single component
npx shadcn@latest view button

# View multiple components
npx shadcn@latest view button card dialog

# View from namespaced registries
npx shadcn@latest view @acme/auth @v0/dashboard
```

### Search Registries

The `search` command finds components across configured registries.

```bash
# Search in the shadcn registry
npx shadcn@latest search @shadcn

# Search with a query
npx shadcn@latest search @shadcn -q "button"

# Search multiple registries
npx shadcn@latest search @shadcn @v0 @acme

# List all items from a registry (alias for search)
npx shadcn@latest list @acme

# Options:
#   -q, --query <query>    Search query string
#   -l, --limit <number>   Max items to display (default: 100)
#   -o, --offset <number>  Number of items to skip (default: 0)
```

### Build Custom Registry

The `build` command generates registry JSON files from your `registry.json` configuration.

```bash
# Build registry with default output (public/r)
npx shadcn@latest build

# Build with custom output directory
npx shadcn@latest build --output ./public/registry

# Build from custom registry.json path
npx shadcn@latest build ./custom-registry.json

# Options:
#   -o, --output <path>  Destination directory for JSON files (default: ./public/r)
#   -c, --cwd <cwd>      Working directory
```

### Run Migrations

The `migrate` command transforms your codebase to support new features or patterns.

```bash
# List available migrations
npx shadcn@latest migrate --list

# Migrate to RTL support
npx shadcn@latest migrate rtl

# Migrate to unified radix-ui package
npx shadcn@latest migrate radix

# Migrate icon library
npx shadcn@latest migrate icons

# Migrate specific files
npx shadcn@latest migrate rtl src/components/ui/button.tsx
npx shadcn@latest migrate radix "src/components/ui/**"

# Options:
#   -l, --list       List all migrations
#   -y, --yes        Skip confirmation prompt
#   -c, --cwd <cwd>  Working directory
```

## Component Usage

### Button Component

The Button component supports multiple variants and sizes with full accessibility.

```tsx
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export function ButtonDemo() {
  return (
    <div className="flex flex-wrap gap-4">
      {/* Default button */}
      <Button>Click me</Button>

      {/* Variants */}
      <Button variant="default">Default</Button>
      <Button variant="destructive">Destructive</Button>
      <Button variant="outline">Outline</Button>
      <Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
      <Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
      <Button variant="link">Link</Button>

      {/* Sizes */}
      <Button size="xs">Extra Small</Button>
      <Button size="sm">Small</Button>
      <Button size="default">Default</Button>
      <Button size="lg">Large</Button>
      <Button size="icon">ðŸ””</Button>

      {/* With icon */}
      <Button>
        <svg data-icon="inline-start" className="size-4" />
        With Icon
      </Button>

      {/* As child (render as different element) */}
      <Button asChild>
        <a href="/dashboard">Go to Dashboard</a>
      </Button>

      {/* Disabled state */}
      <Button disabled>Disabled</Button>
    </div>
  )
}
```

### Card Component

The Card component provides a flexible container for content with header, body, and footer sections.

```tsx
import {
  Card,
  CardAction,
  CardContent,
  CardDescription,
  CardFooter,
  CardHeader,
  CardTitle,
} from "@/components/ui/card"
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export function CardDemo() {
  return (
    <Card className="w-[350px]">
      <CardHeader>
        <CardTitle>Create project</CardTitle>
        <CardDescription>Deploy your new project in one-click.</CardDescription>
        <CardAction>
          <Button variant="ghost" size="icon">â‹®</Button>
        </CardAction>
      </CardHeader>
      <CardContent>
        <form>
          <div className="grid w-full items-center gap-4">
            <div className="flex flex-col space-y-1.5">
              <label htmlFor="name">Name</label>
              <input id="name" placeholder="Name of your project" />
            </div>
          </div>
        </form>
      </CardContent>
      <CardFooter className="flex justify-between">
        <Button variant="outline">Cancel</Button>
        <Button>Deploy</Button>
      </CardFooter>
    </Card>
  )
}
```

### Dialog Component

The Dialog component creates accessible modal windows with customizable content.

```tsx
import {
  Dialog,
  DialogClose,
  DialogContent,
  DialogDescription,
  DialogFooter,
  DialogHeader,
  DialogTitle,
  DialogTrigger,
} from "@/components/ui/dialog"
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"
import { Input } from "@/components/ui/input"
import { Label } from "@/components/ui/label"

export function DialogDemo() {
  return (
    <Dialog>
      <DialogTrigger asChild>
        <Button variant="outline">Edit Profile</Button>
      </DialogTrigger>
      <DialogContent className="sm:max-w-[425px]">
        <DialogHeader>
          <DialogTitle>Edit profile</DialogTitle>
          <DialogDescription>
            Make changes to your profile here. Click save when you're done.
          </DialogDescription>
        </DialogHeader>
        <div className="grid gap-4 py-4">
          <div className="grid grid-cols-4 items-center gap-4">
            <Label htmlFor="name" className="text-right">Name</Label>
            <Input id="name" defaultValue="John Doe" className="col-span-3" />
          </div>
          <div className="grid grid-cols-4 items-center gap-4">
            <Label htmlFor="username" className="text-right">Username</Label>
            <Input id="username" defaultValue="@johndoe" className="col-span-3" />
          </div>
        </div>
        <DialogFooter>
          <Button type="submit">Save changes</Button>
        </DialogFooter>
      </DialogContent>
    </Dialog>
  )
}

// Dialog without close button
export function DialogNoClose() {
  return (
    <Dialog>
      <DialogTrigger asChild>
        <Button>Open</Button>
      </DialogTrigger>
      <DialogContent showCloseButton={false}>
        <DialogHeader>
          <DialogTitle>Custom Dialog</DialogTitle>
        </DialogHeader>
        <DialogFooter showCloseButton>
          <Button>Confirm</Button>
        </DialogFooter>
      </DialogContent>
    </Dialog>
  )
}
```

### Form with React Hook Form

The Form component integrates with React Hook Form for validation and state management.

```tsx
"use client"

import { zodResolver } from "@hookform/resolvers/zod"
import { useForm } from "react-hook-form"
import * as z from "zod"
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"
import {
  Form,
  FormControl,
  FormDescription,
  FormField,
  FormItem,
  FormLabel,
  FormMessage,
} from "@/components/ui/form"
import { Input } from "@/components/ui/input"

const formSchema = z.object({
  username: z.string().min(2, {
    message: "Username must be at least 2 characters.",
  }),
  email: z.string().email({
    message: "Please enter a valid email address.",
  }),
})

export function ProfileForm() {
  const form = useForm<z.infer<typeof formSchema>>({
    resolver: zodResolver(formSchema),
    defaultValues: {
      username: "",
      email: "",
    },
  })

  function onSubmit(values: z.infer<typeof formSchema>) {
    console.log(values)
  }

  return (
    <Form {...form}>
      <form onSubmit={form.handleSubmit(onSubmit)} className="space-y-8">
        <FormField
          control={form.control}
          name="username"
          render={({ field }) => (
            <FormItem>
              <FormLabel>Username</FormLabel>
              <FormControl>
                <Input placeholder="johndoe" {...field} />
              </FormControl>
              <FormDescription>
                This is your public display name.
              </FormDescription>
              <FormMessage />
            </FormItem>
          )}
        />
        <FormField
          control={form.control}
          name="email"
          render={({ field }) => (
            <FormItem>
              <FormLabel>Email</FormLabel>
              <FormControl>
                <Input placeholder="john@example.com" {...field} />
              </FormControl>
              <FormMessage />
            </FormItem>
          )}
        />
        <Button type="submit">Submit</Button>
      </form>
    </Form>
  )
}
```

## Configuration

### components.json Configuration

The `components.json` file configures how shadcn/ui works in your project.

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://ui.shadcn.com/schema.json",
  "style": "new-york",
  "rsc": true,
  "tsx": true,
  "tailwind": {
    "config": "",
    "css": "app/globals.css",
    "baseColor": "neutral",
    "cssVariables": true,
    "prefix": ""
  },
  "iconLibrary": "lucide",
  "aliases": {
    "components": "@/components",
    "utils": "@/lib/utils",
    "ui": "@/components/ui",
    "lib": "@/lib",
    "hooks": "@/hooks"
  },
  "registries": {
    "@v0": "https://v0.dev/chat/b/{name}",
    "@acme": "https://registry.acme.com/{name}.json",
    "@private": {
      "url": "https://api.company.com/registry/{name}.json",
      "headers": {
        "Authorization": "Bearer ${REGISTRY_TOKEN}"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### Theming with CSS Variables

Define custom theme colors using CSS variables in your global stylesheet.

```css
/* app/globals.css */
@import "tailwindcss";

:root {
  --radius: 0.625rem;
  --background: oklch(1 0 0);
  --foreground: oklch(0.145 0 0);
  --card: oklch(1 0 0);
  --card-foreground: oklch(0.145 0 0);
  --popover: oklch(1 0 0);
  --popover-foreground: oklch(0.145 0 0);
  --primary: oklch(0.205 0 0);
  --primary-foreground: oklch(0.985 0 0);
  --secondary: oklch(0.97 0 0);
  --secondary-foreground: oklch(0.205 0 0);
  --muted: oklch(0.97 0 0);
  --muted-foreground: oklch(0.556 0 0);
  --accent: oklch(0.97 0 0);
  --accent-foreground: oklch(0.205 0 0);
  --destructive: oklch(0.577 0.245 27.325);
  --destructive-foreground: oklch(0.985 0 0);
  --border: oklch(0.922 0 0);
  --input: oklch(0.922 0 0);
  --ring: oklch(0.708 0 0);
}

.dark {
  --background: oklch(0.145 0 0);
  --foreground: oklch(0.985 0 0);
  --primary: oklch(0.922 0 0);
  --primary-foreground: oklch(0.205 0 0);
  /* ... other dark mode variables */
}

/* Add custom colors */
:root {
  --warning: oklch(0.84 0.16 84);
  --warning-foreground: oklch(0.28 0.07 46);
}

@theme inline {
  --color-warning: var(--warning);
  --color-warning-foreground: var(--warning-foreground);
}
```

## MCP Server Integration

### Configure MCP for AI Assistants

The shadcn MCP server enables AI assistants to browse, search, and install components using natural language.

```bash
# Initialize MCP for Claude Code
npx shadcn@latest mcp init --client claude

# Initialize for Cursor
npx shadcn@latest mcp init --client cursor

# Initialize for VS Code
npx shadcn@latest mcp init --client vscode

# Initialize for OpenCode
npx shadcn@latest mcp init --client opencode
```

```json
// .mcp.json (Claude Code configuration)
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "shadcn": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["shadcn@latest", "mcp"]
    }
  }
}
```

```json
// .cursor/mcp.json (Cursor configuration)
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "shadcn": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["shadcn@latest", "mcp"]
    }
  }
}
```

```json
// .vscode/mcp.json (VS Code configuration)
{
  "servers": {
    "shadcn": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["shadcn@latest", "mcp"]
    }
  }
}
```

## Custom Registry

### Create and Host Your Own Registry

Build a custom component registry to share components across projects or with your team.

```json
// registry.json
{
  "$schema": "https://ui.shadcn.com/schema/registry.json",
  "name": "acme",
  "homepage": "https://acme.com",
  "items": [
    {
      "name": "hello-world",
      "type": "registry:block",
      "title": "Hello World",
      "description": "A simple hello world component.",
      "registryDependencies": ["button"],
      "dependencies": ["motion"],
      "files": [
        {
          "path": "registry/new-york/hello-world/hello-world.tsx",
          "type": "registry:component"
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "auth-form",
      "type": "registry:block",
      "title": "Authentication Form",
      "description": "A complete authentication form with validation.",
      "registryDependencies": ["button", "input", "label", "card"],
      "dependencies": ["zod", "react-hook-form"],
      "files": [
        {
          "path": "registry/new-york/auth-form/auth-form.tsx",
          "type": "registry:component"
        },
        {
          "path": "registry/new-york/auth-form/use-auth.ts",
          "type": "registry:hook"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

```tsx
// registry/new-york/hello-world/hello-world.tsx
import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"

export function HelloWorld() {
  return <Button>Hello World</Button>
}
```

```bash
# Add build script to package.json
npm pkg set scripts.registry:build="shadcn build"

# Build the registry
npm run registry:build

# Files are generated at public/r/[name].json
# Install from your registry
npx shadcn@latest add https://acme.com/r/hello-world.json
```

## Monorepo Setup

### Configure shadcn/ui for Monorepo Projects

Set up shadcn/ui in a monorepo with shared UI components.

```bash
# Create a new monorepo project
npx shadcn@latest init
# Select: Next.js (Monorepo)
```

```json
// apps/web/components.json
{
  "$schema": "https://ui.shadcn.com/schema.json",
  "style": "new-york",
  "rsc": true,
  "tsx": true,
  "tailwind": {
    "config": "",
    "css": "../../packages/ui/src/styles/globals.css",
    "baseColor": "zinc",
    "cssVariables": true
  },
  "aliases": {
    "components": "@/components",
    "hooks": "@/hooks",
    "lib": "@/lib",
    "utils": "@workspace/ui/lib/utils",
    "ui": "@workspace/ui/components"
  }
}
```

```json
// packages/ui/components.json
{
  "$schema": "https://ui.shadcn.com/schema.json",
  "style": "new-york",
  "rsc": true,
  "tsx": true,
  "tailwind": {
    "config": "",
    "css": "src/styles/globals.css",
    "baseColor": "zinc",
    "cssVariables": true
  },
  "aliases": {
    "components": "@workspace/ui/components",
    "utils": "@workspace/ui/lib/utils",
    "hooks": "@workspace/ui/hooks",
    "lib": "@workspace/ui/lib",
    "ui": "@workspace/ui/components"
  }
}
```

```tsx
// apps/web/app/page.tsx
import { Button } from "@workspace/ui/components/button"
import { cn } from "@workspace/ui/lib/utils"

export default function Home() {
  return (
    <main className={cn("flex min-h-screen items-center justify-center")}>
      <Button>Click me</Button>
    </main>
  )
}
```

## Summary

shadcn/ui is designed for developers who want full control over their component code. The primary use cases include: building custom design systems where you need to modify component internals, creating consistent UI across multiple projects using custom registries, and integrating with AI-powered development tools through the MCP server. The CLI simplifies setup across Next.js, Vite, Remix, and other frameworks while supporting both standard projects and monorepo architectures.

Integration patterns typically involve initializing a project with `npx shadcn@latest init`, adding components as needed with `npx shadcn@latest add`, and customizing the generated source code to match your design requirements. For teams, the registry system allows sharing custom components through namespaced registries configured in `components.json`. The CSS variable-based theming system makes it easy to implement dark mode and custom color schemes while maintaining consistency across all components.
